intro: Artabotrys sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak lantern tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the Annonaceae family and is known for its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. The flowers are pollinated by insects and birds, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
